alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 9:21PM CDT until June 04 at 4:25AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Missouri, including the following counties, Cass, Jackson, Johnson MO, Lafayette and Ray. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 921 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Blue Springs, Leawood, Raytown, Grandview, Belton, Raymore, Grain Valley, Harrisonville, Pleasant Hill, Oak Grove, Odessa, Greenwood, Peculiar, Buckner, Holden and Lake Lotawana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
